cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi (380 km) E of Tampico, Mexico and 330 mi (530 km) SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northeast through Saturday, then turn slowly north and eventually west toward the central-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda/Port Oâ€™Connor

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western and north-western Gulf of Mexico coastline from northern Mexico to the upper Texas and southwestern Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; peak sustained winds generally below tropical-storm force (less than 39 mph) with an outside chance of brief gusts around 30 mph late weekend to Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above minor astronomical tides along the Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periodic rain bands could bring 1-3 inches of rain between Sunday and Tuesday, locally higher in squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along Mississippi beaches beginning this weekend.
